messages.message:
A light earthquake magnitude 4.8 (ml/mb) has occurred on Saturday, southeast of the Loyalty Islands (0 miles).
Id of earthquake: us6000nhe6.
Date and time of earthquake in UTC/GMT: 20/07/24 / 2024-07-20 21:01:21 / July 20, 2024 @ 9:01 pm.
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, detected near: southeast of the Loyalty Islands.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.2 (ml/mb) has struck on Saturday, 147 km SSE of Vilyuchinsk, Russia (91 miles).
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
The 4.2-magnitude earthquake has occurred at 23:22:37 / 11:22 pm (local time epicenter).
Exact location of earthquake, 159.103° East, 51.6784° North, depth 50.108 km.
Read more about the earthquake, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters, Location and details about this quake, that has struck: 147 km SSE of Vilyuchinsk, Russia.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4.6 (ml/mb) was reported 4 kilometers (2 miles) from Yalina in Mexico on Thursday.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 63.306 km (39 miles).
Id of earthquake: us6000nhf7.
The 4.6-magnitude earthquake has occurred at 19:19:01 / 7:19 pm (local time epicenter).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: 4 km NW of Yalina, Mexico.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.5 (ml/mb) strikes Banda Sea (0 miles) on Friday.
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
Exact location of earthquake, 129.3886° East, -6.9858° South, depth 123.799 km.
The earthquake was roughly at a depth of 123.799 km (77 miles).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: Banda Sea.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.6 (ml/mb) has occurred on Saturday, 68 kilometers (42 miles) from Port-Vila in Vanuatu.
The epicenter of the earthquake was roughly 10 km (6 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Event ids that are associated to the earthquake: us6000nhdv.
The epicenter was 69 km (43 miles) from Port-Vila (c. 35 900 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, that has occurred near: 68 km WNW of Port-Vila, Vanuatu.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.5 (ml/mb) has struck on Thursday, 50 kilometers (31 miles) from Yomitan in Japan.
Exact location of earthquake, longitude 127.2416 East, latitude 26.4762 North, depth = 51.946 km.
The earthquake was roughly at a depth of 51.946 km (32 miles).
Country/countries that might be effected, Japan (c. 127 288 000 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Location, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters and details about this quake, reported near: 50 km W of Yomitan, Japan.

A light earthquake with magnitude 4.6 (ml/mb) was detected on Friday, 39 kilometers (24 miles) from Rabaul in Papua New Guinea.
Exact location of earthquake, 151.9283° East, -4.4699° South, depth 156.303 km.
The epicenter was 39 km (24 miles) from Kokopo (c. 26 300 pop), 41 km (25 miles) from Rabaul (c. 8 100 pop).
Nearby country/countries that might be effected, Papua New Guinea (c. 6 065 000 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Location, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters and details about this quake, reported near: 39 km SW of Rabaul, Papua New Guinea.

A light earthquake magnitude 4.3 (ml/mb) has occurred on Thursday, 54 kilometers (34 miles) from Sarangani in Philippines.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 94.34 km (59 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Nearby country/countries, Philippines (c. 99 900 000 pop) (That might be effected).
Epicenter of the event was 90 km (56 miles) from Caburan (c. 12 600 pop), 55 km (34 miles) from Sarangani (c. 7 500 pop), 91 km (57 miles) from Pangyan (c. 5 300 pop).
Read more about the earthquake, Location, Distances, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Parameters and details about this quake, reported near: 54 km ESE of Sarangani, Philippines.

Rain-related disasters have killed more than 250 in a deadly week across AsiaFILE - Rescuers use a dinghy boat to evacuate villagers trapped by floodwaters in Jingtang village, Zixing city, in southern China's Hunan province, on July 28, 2024.
(Chinatopix via AP, File)In India and China, torrential rains have killed more than 250 people in the past week.
Widespread flooding has been reported in North Korea near the border with China with no word on whether anyone died.
In North Korea, the rain flooded 4,100 houses, 3,000 hectares (7,400 acres) of farmland and many public buildings, roads and railways.
One city near North Korea asked people living below the third floor to move higher as the Yalu River rose.

(Chen Zhenhai/Xinhua via AP, File)In India and China, torrential rains have killed more than 250 people in the past week.
Widespread flooding has been reported in North Korea near the border with China with no word on whether anyone died.
This time of year is monsoon and typhoon season in Asia, and climate change has intensified such storms.
In North Korea, the rain flooded 4,100 houses, 3,000 hectares (7,400 acres) of farmland and many public buildings, roads and railways.
One city near North Korea asked people living below the third floor to move higher as the Yalu River rose.

In India and China, torrential rains have killed more than 250 people in the past week.
Widespread flooding has been reported in North Korea near the border with China with no word on whether anyone died.
Heavy rains have triggered landslides and flooding, devastating crops, destroying homes and taking lives.
(AP Photo/Fareed Khan, File)In North Korea, the rain flooded 4,100 houses, 3,000 hectares (7,400 acres) of farmland and many public buildings, roads and railways.
One city near North Korea asked people living below the third floor to move higher as the Yalu River rose.

In India and China, torrential rains have killed more than 200 people in the past week.
Widespread flooding has been reported in North Korea near the border with China with no word on whether anyone died.
North Korea: Damage, but no information on deathsThe tropical storm also generated heavy rain in northeast China on the border with North Korea, overflowing the Yalu River, which divides the two countries.
In North Korea, the rain flooded 4,100 houses, 7,400 acres of farmland and many public buildings, roads and railways.
One city near North Korea asked people living below the third floor to move higher as the Yalu River rose.

One city near North Korea asked people living below the third floor to move higher as the Yalu River rose.

In North Korea, the rain flooded 4,100 houses, 3,000 hectares (7,400 acres) of farmland and many public buildings, roads and railways.
One city near North Korea asked people living below the third floor to move higher as the Yalu River rose.

The National Hurricane Center has started to issue tropical storm warnings and watches for parts of Florida on Friday as confidence continues to grow that a tropical wave near eastern Cuba will strengthen into a tropical storm in the next two days.
A tropical storm watch is in effect for:The Florida Keys south of the Card Sound Bridge including the Dry Tortugas.
A tropical storm warning indicates tropical storm conditions — heavy rain, rough surf, and winds gusting as high as 39 to 73 mph — are expected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours, and a tropical storm watch means tropical storm conditions are possible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
The season, which officially began on June 1, has seen three named storms — Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris.
Beryl rapidly intensified from a tropical storm to a monster hurricane, reaching Category 5 status with top sustained winds of 165 mph.

Tropical storm warnings are in effect for the southwest coast of the Florida peninsula, the National Hurricane Center (NHC) has said.
Tropical storm warnings, indicating tropical storm conditions are expected in the warning area within 36 hours, are now in effect for a stretch of southwest Florida from East Cape Sable to Bonita Beach.
A tropical storm watch, indicating possible tropical storm conditions in the watch area generally within 48 hours, is in effect for the lower Florida Keys south of the Card Sound Bridge, Dry Tortugas National Park, and the Florida coast north of Bonita Beach to Aripeka.
Tropical storm conditions in the warning area are expected to arrive by late Aug. 3 and are possible in the watch area between the night of Aug. 3 and Aug. 4.
The National Weather Service (NWS) defines a tropical storm as boasting winds of between 39 mph and 73 mph.

A Tropical Storm Watch means that tropical storm conditions are possible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
Interests elsewhere in the Florida Peninsula should monitor the progress of this system.
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND:WINDS: Tropical storm conditions are expected in the warning area late Saturday and Saturday night.
Tropical storm conditions are possible in the watch area in the Florida Keys and the southern Florida peninsula by Saturday or Saturday night.
Tropical storm conditions are possible in the watch area along the Florida west coast Saturday night or Sunday.

The Sunshine State is bracing for impacts from Potential Cyclone Four.
The National Hurricane Center's 11am advisory states:A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for...* Southwest coast of the Florida peninsula from East Cape Sable toBonita BeachA Tropical Storm Watch is in effect for...* The Florida Keys south of the Card Sound Bridge including the DryTortugas* The southern coast of the Florida peninsula east of East CapeSable to the Card Sound Bridge* The west coast of the Florida peninsula north of Bonita Beach toAripekaA Tropical Storm Warning means that tropical storm conditions areexpected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A Tropical Storm Watch means that tropical storm conditions arepossible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
Interests elsewhere in the Florida Peninsula should monitor theprogress of this system.
Additional warnings and watches may berequired for a portion of this area tonight and Saturday.

Tropical storm watches and warnings have been issued for portions of Florida, including a storm watch in Fort Myers and Lee County, ahead of a possible landfall as Tropical Storm Debby along Florida's West Coast over the weekend.
A tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions are expected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A watch means that tropical storm conditions are possible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
A tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions are expected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A tropical storm watch means that tropical storm conditions are possible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.

TAMPA, Fla. - Invest 97L is now Potential Tropical Cyclone Four and portions of Florida are under a Tropical Storm Watch of Warning.
A Tropical Storm Warning has been issued in Southwest Florida from East Cape Sable to Bonita Beach.
A Tropical Storm Warning means that tropical storm conditions are expected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A Tropical Storm Watch means that tropical storm conditions are possible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
She expects Potential Tropical Cyclone 4 to become a tropical low and possible Tropical Storm Debby on Saturday as it moves into the Florida Straits.

A tropical storm warning has been issued for Southwest Florida, and heavy rains will drop six to eight inches of rain between Saturday and Wednesday.
A tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions are expected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A watch means that tropical storm conditions are possible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
Potential cyclone heading to Southwest FloridaBefore it's called a depression, it's referred to as a potential cyclone, as it was during the 11 a.m. Friday update.
And Sunday it will be parallel to the coast between Fort Myers and Tampa.

ORLANDO, Fla. – A tropical wave continues on its path toward Florida, bringing the threat of heavy rain.
The National Hurricane Center on Friday designated Potential Tropical Cyclone Four, which was Invest 97L, over eastern Cuba.
PTC Four TrackA tropical storm warning is in effect for the southwest coast of the Florida peninsula, from East Cape Sable to Bonita Beach.
A tropical storm watch is in effect for the Florida Keys south of the Card Sound Bridge including the Dry Tortugas, the southern coast of the Florida peninsula east of East Cape Sable to the Card Sound bridge, and for the west coast of the Florida peninsula north of Bonita Beach to Aripeka.
The latest tropical models differ a bit on where the system will be by Sunday and its intensity.

The Sunshine State is bracing for impacts from Potential Cyclone Four.

Additional warnings and watches may berequired for a portion of this area tonight and Saturday.
